title: Trump says AI is taking over the world
description: Donald Trump joked that artificial intelligence (AI) is taking over the world whilst speaking with Sir Keir Starmer on Thursday (18 September). On the second day of his state visit to the UK, the US president met with the prime minister at his Chequers residence, where they signed the £150billion “Tech Prosperity Deal”, which will see the two nations co-operate in fields such as AI, quantum technology and nuclear power. Speaking to tech leaders who were present at the event in Buckinghamshire, Mr Trump said: “AI is taking over the world, I’m looking at you guys!” Addressing Nvidia's Jensen Huang, the US president laughed as he said: “Jensen, I don’t know what you’re doing here. All I can say is we hope you’re right.”
content:
Donald Trump joked that artificial intelligence (AI) is taking over the world whilst speaking with Sir Keir Starmer on Thursday (18 September).

title: Govt has big focus on AI skilling, says Ashwini Vaishnaw
description: Union Information and Technology Minister, Ashwini Vaishnaw, on Thursday said that the government has a big focus on skilling in the area of Artificial Intelligence (AI).
content:
New Delhi [India], September 18 (ANI): Union Information and Technology Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw, on Thursday, said that the government has a big focus on skilling in the area of Artificial Intelligence (AI).

title: Nvidia to invest $5 billion in Intel and develop chips with one-time rival
description: Nvidia, the semiconductor company powering the artificial intelligence revolution, said it was buying a $5 billion stake in its ailing rival Intel
content:
Nvidia, the semiconductor company powering the artificial intelligence revolution, said it was buying a $5 billion stake in its ailing rival Intel.
The two companies will also begin a partnership to develop chips together for PCs and data centers.

title: China's DeepSeek says its hit AI model cost just $294,000 to train
description: Chinese AI developer DeepSeek said it spent $294,000 on training its R1 model, much lower than figures reported for U.S. rivals, in a paper that is likely to reignite debate over Beijing's place in the race to develop artificial intelligence.
content: BEIJING, Sept 18 (Reuters) - Chinese AI developer DeepSeek said it spent $294,000 on training its R1 model, much lower than figures reported for U.S. rivals, in a paper that is likely to reignite debate over Beijing's place in the race to develop art... [2365 chars]

title: Telus, Samsung partner in shift to AI networks
description: Telus Corp. is partnering with Samsung to deploy what it calls Canada’s first commercial radio access network intelligent controller, a software platform that will help eventually deliver networks fully powered by artificial intelligence.

title: Nvidia will take a $5 billion stake in Intel, joining the US government as a major shareholder
description: By Olesya Dmitracova, CNN (CNN) — Nvidia said on Thursday that it would buy $5 billion worth of Intel’s common stock, becoming another major shareholder in the beleaguered company just weeks after the US government took a roughly 10% stake. The tech giant, which makes artificial intelligence chips, will pay $23.28 per share, it said
content:

description: Sheffield University invites international applications for its MSc Artificial Intelligence for Engineering, starting September 2026.

title: Nvidia bets big on Intel with $5 billion stake and chip partnership
description: Nvidia, whose must-have chips are powering a global artificial intelligence boom, said in a statement it will pay $23.28 per share for Intel common stock, a price slightly below the $24.90 at which Intel shares closed on Wednesday.

title: UK-based Humanoid unveils first robot for industrial use
description: Humanoid on Thursday unveiled the UK's first humanoid robot for industrial use, as the startup hopes to gain a foothold in the growing artificial intelligence robotics industry.
content:
